intro: Holoptelea grandis, commonly known as the large-leaf holoptelea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its woody stem and branching structure make it a distinctive shrub or small tree. The plant is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland habitats.
